fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we insert a HTML value in a *multiple line text field* text field in JIRA it shows as text and not HTML. 

h3. Environment

* JIRA version 7.1.2
* JIRA version 7.3.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Manage Add ons page > system add ons
# Search for *Wiki Renderer Macros Plugin* and make sure *html* module is enabled. (by default it is disabled due to security concern)
# Add a multi line text field custom field to one of JIRA project.
# Create a new issue for this project and add *html* context in the custom field.

h3. Expected Results

The HTML is properly rendered in the custom field

h3. Actual Result

The HTML is not being rendered as HTML instead it is shown as TEXT as shown in below image:
!html.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: HTML is Not Properly Rendered in JIRA Custom Field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

XML Backup will be corrupted when generated while DVCS synchronization is running.

h3. Environment 
* DVCS is configured and sync is running

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure JIRA with DVCS connection to Bitbucket
# While DVCS synchronization is running, create an XML backup

h3. Expected Results
The XML backup created are usable and restored correctly

h3. Actual Results
Trying to restore the XML backup created will throw the error in the UI and logs
{code}
There was a problem restoring ActiveObjects data for the <unknown plugin> plugin. Caught exception with following message: ERROR: insert or update on table "AO_E8B6CC_ISSUE_TO_CHANGESET" violates foreign key constraint "fk_ao_e8b6cc_issue_to_changeset_changeset_id" Detail: Key (CHANGESET_ID)=(1885) is not present in table "AO_E8B6CC_CHANGESET_MAPPING". Please check the log for details.
{code}

h3.Workaround
* Create an XML backup with the following JVM arguments in place ( restart required ). This will stop all outgoing connections:
{code}
-Dhttp.proxyHost=127.255.255.255 -Dhttp.proxyPort=1234 -Dhttps.proxyHost=127.255.255.255 -Dhttps.proxyPort=1234 -Dhttp.nonProxyHosts=localhost
{code}
* Rely on native database backup
fields.summary: XML Backup gets corrupted when generated while DVCS sync

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Depending on the order of startup in a clustered JIRA instance, it's possible the cluster cache replication health check may fail initially on startup. However when accessing the health check page it shows as a pass.

h3. Environment

JIRA Data Center (JDC) only.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

This is a race condition so will only occur on certain times that JDC is started. It is exacerbated by Zero Downtime Upgrades as this involves more frequent restarting of JIRA nodes.

h3. Expected Results

The health check does not fail, as the order of heartbeat propagation is correct.

h3. Actual Results

The health check reports failure, however when executing the check again it passes.

h3. Notes

This is due to the timing of startup - the health check implements its own heartbeat that is used to propagate cache data across nodes. This heart beat scheduled is started after the plugin has started and the plugin framework is available. We also have a health check scheduler is scheduled to execute a minute after startup. Due to the timing of the various starts it's possible the health check scheduler is executed before the heartbeat has propagated the cache. Due to this the check will initially fail.
fields.summary: Cluster Cache Replication Health Check can fail with a false positive in JIRA Data Center

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64043].
  {panel}

There doesn't seem to be any means to set the calendar start day to either Friday or Saturday.

This is really affecting our remote teams as local calendars, and cultural default is that the calendar week starts on a Saturday, (Some countries default calendar starts on Friday too).

But, for the most part, this precludes people from viewing calendars in a "normal" format for the following countries:

BD, MV, AE, AF, BH, DJ, DZ, EG, IQ, IR, JO, KW, LY, MA, OM, QA, SD, SY...

Bangladesh, Maldives, UAE, Afghanistan, Bahrain, Djibouti, Algeria, Egypt, Iraq, Iran, Jordan, Kuwait, Lybia, Oman, Morocco, Sudan, Syria, ...
fields.summary: Cannot Set Start of Week to Friday or Saturday

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64038].
  {panel}

Every time I install a new plugin (happen a lot at our shop)  I have to go in and set the various services to either WARN or ERROR as I will set it to INFO or DEBUG when I am diagnosing a problem only.  

It would be great to have a pull down that say "set all services to", so I could set everything to WARN at once, and then I could go and and tweak on an individual basis all the ones I wanted something else.

Or I could go in and edit log4j.properties, and then if there was a default that every time a new value was put into the file it would read the default and use it.

Just my two cents...
fields.summary: Have a set all or default setting for Logging and Profiling

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Navigate to _JIRA Installation Folder > bin_
# Run the \{\{config.bat/sh}} to use JIRA Configuration Tool.
# Change to "Web Server" tab.
# Change to Https protocol and fill in the required fields.
# Saved the configuration.
# Run JIRA.

h3. Expected Result:
* JIRA will start and accessible through HTTPS connector.

h3. Actual result:
* JIRA would not be able to start due to the HTTPS connector with error:
{code}
07-Feb-2017 13:23:12.795 SEVERE [main] org.apache.catalina.core.StandardService.initInternal Failed to initialize connector [Connector[org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol-443]]
 org.apache.catalina.LifecycleException: Failed to initialize component [Connector[org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol-443]]
 at org.apache.catalina.util.LifecycleBase.init(LifecycleBase.java:112)
 at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardService.initInternal(StandardService.java:549)
 at org.apache.catalina.util.LifecycleBase.init(LifecycleBase.java:107)
 ...
{code}

h3. Notes:
* The cause will be the protocol used is not \{\{org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol}} as mentioned in:
** [JIRA Software 7.3 Upgrade Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-3-x-upgrade-notes-861251109.html]
* The tool is still using \{\{org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol}}
fields.summary: JIRA Configuration Tool did not use the right protocol for SSL

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64036].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Starting from JIRA 7.3 project administrator are allowed to edit workflow as long as the project workflow fulfill below criteria:
# The workflow isn't shared with any other projects (it's only available in your project),
# The workflow isn't the default JIRA workflow (no-one can edit these workflows).

However Project administrator cannot configure any resolutions or force users to provide a resolution in a workflow. As mentioned in [Workflows|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver073/workflows-861256323.html], project administrator:
# Create, add, edit or delete transitions (you can't edit a transition's properties, conditions, validators or post-functions).

Due the fact that post function and condition are not allowed to be edited by project admin it makes impossible for project admin to define resolution for an editted workflow.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Project admins to *edit a transition's properties, conditions, validators or post-functions* so that project adminstrator can add resolution or force user to select resolution when an user is closing an issue
fields.summary: Ability to Configure Resolution In Workflow by Project Administrator

h3. Problem Definition
When exporting an issue using the printable export, it does not export the issue activity and only comments are exported along with the issue details.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow JIRA to export the issue activity on the printable export.


h3. Workaround 
Use the browser print feature to print the entire screen. Make sure to add _?filter=-1_ at the end of the issue URL in order to be able to print all the activity in case it has multiple pages (e.g http://jira-server/browse/TEST-1?filter=-1)
(i) Please make sure that Issue Navigator is configured as *List View* before trying this workaround. If it is configured as *Detailed View*, you will redirect to Issue Navigator when accessing the issue page.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA to export the issue activity on the printable export.

h3. Problem Definition
We currently only support the quartz syntax [Quartz Scheduled Cron jobs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/scheduled-jobs-96567525.html#ScheduledJobs-Cronexpressions] which doesn't allow for calculations such as every other week on a specific day. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement syntax that allows for calculations as indicated above. 
h3. Why this is important
 It gives the customer the granularity to schedule services in specific time windows of low usage or time frames that are reserved for maintenance windows.
fields.summary: Allow cron schedule to be specified in every other week intervals.

h3. Problem Definition
When performing an upgrade with the installer the backups are archived in a zip format, which does not preserve file permissions in Linux/Unix (just in Windows). This can cause problems during the restore.

h3. Suggested Solution
Use a file format for the backup like tar or tar.gz for the backup that would preserve and store the file permission in the archive.

h3. Workaround
Manually apply permissions to the {{<confluence-home>}} and {{<confluence-install>}} directories for the user account that runs the application.
fields.summary: Linux/Unix installer backup should create backup file with an archive that preserves the file permission

 # User B drags the issue to the Version and panel
 # Right after dragging the issue, check the Mail queue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64021].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

When Site Admin login as another user in JIRA, the only security measure available at the moment is to send an email notification to the actual user that the admin is logging in with his account. However, there is no log that keep track of who login as the user, at what time, and what did he do with it.

This may cause some loophole in the security, in which the site admin would be able to log in as other user and make crucial changes without the person in contact knowing.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to record when a Site Admin login as another user, the duration of the session, and what actions that the Site Admin do as the user.
fields.summary: Record in a log when a Site Admin login as another user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64008].
  {panel}

h3. *Problem Definition*
When cloning an issue in JIRA, an existing issues is copied into a new issues and a ‘clone’ link is created between the original issue and the newly created (clone) issue. 

h3. *Suggested Solution*
Add the possibility to create another link relationship (e.g. ‘implement’ link) between the original issue and the newly created issue, either instead of the ‘clone’ link or in addition to the ‘clone’ link.

h3. *Why this request*
Cloning of issues is typically done to create a hierarchy of issues (parent-child relationship). For example, implementing a Business Epic ‘A’ requires the implementation of features ‘X’, ‘Y’ and ‘Z’. Implementation of feature ‘X’ requires work in JIRA project ‘P1’, ‘P2’ and ‘P3’, for feature ‘Y’ it requires work in project ‘P2’, ‘P4’, etcetera. So ‘A’ must be cloned to ‘X’, ‘Y’ and ‘Z’ and from there issues need to be cloned to ‘P1’, ‘P2’, etc. All hierarchy relationships require an ‘implement’ link between the parent and the child.
“Clone & move” is used to create the issues, but for each newly created issues the “Link” function must be used to create the parent-child relationship with the ‘implement’ link.
Since it typically involves a large number of new issues, it is a lot of work switching between “Clone & Move” and the “Link” function, and it is easy to make a mistake (e.g. linking the wrong issue ids, or omitting the ‘implement’ link). By including the linking in the clone function, JIRA knows exactly which issues are concerned (i.e. the original and the clone) reducing the amount of work and reducing the amount of mistakes, and the user is more likely (to not forget) to create the link.


h3. *Why this is important*
# The hierarchical structure has an immediate impact on the development planning, and therefore mistakes have too (e.g. missing ‘implement’ links). Similarly the mistakes have impact on the progress control of business epics.
# The hierarchical structure will be used for aggregating time writing (from JIRA to Clarity) and time writing is used to account financial of projects (Clarity). Mistakes in the hierarchy will have impact on the financial accounting to projects.
fields.summary: Improve Existing Clone Link Feature in JIRA
Add a "checkbox" feature to the Description Editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64004].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The JIRA Cloud Document: [Import and export data |https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/import-and-export-data-744721621.html]
 for step 1 refers to JIRA applications [Importing issues |https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-issues-776636788.html] This document details at Point 2 step 1:
{quote}2. Import the data
 1. Upload the files to the cloud by [using WebDAV |https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/upload-data-via-webdav-744721622.html]. (For backup files larger than 4GB, refer to [Uploading Large files to WebDAV |https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/uploading-large-files-to-webdav-747834468.html])
{quote}
The first link: [using WebDAV |https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/upload-data-via-webdav-744721622.html] is a reciprocal link back to document 1 with no additional information

The Second Link [Uploading Large files to WebDAV |https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/uploading-large-files-to-webdav-747834468.html] Notes the Deprication of the webdav with:
{quote}(!) Atlassian Cloud applications no longer support WebDAV. For updated import information, please refer to [Import and export data |https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/import-and-export-data-744721621.html].
{quote}
The link provided [Import and export data |https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/import-and-export-data-744721621.html] is also a link back to the first document with no additional information on the new process for uploading data for a Import.
h3. Suggested Solution

The new process needs to be detailed in the import documentation directly.

Since of the Depreciation of the WebDav the new process has been added in the Cloud instance directly on the *Second Step* of the *JIRA Import Wizard* So the only way to notified of the new process is to initiate the process before reading the documentation pages as you must start the import to reveal these details:
{quote}
h2.Before you begin
# Back up your JIRA Cloud site data using Backup Manager
 # Prepare an export of your other JIRA Cloud or Server instance.
 # If you want to include attachments, avatars, or logos in this import, create compressed copies of the following:
 * <JIRA_HOME>/data/attachments directory (with attachments as the top-level directory, or project keys within attachments as the top-level directory).
 * <JIRA_HOME>/data/avatars directory (with avatars as the top-level directory)
 * <JIRA_HOME>/logos directory (with logos as the top-level directory)
{quote}
!Screen Shot 2017-02-06 at 4.41.01 PM.png|thumbnail!

Between step 2 and 3 the JIRA Import File only file is uploaded from local file system to the webdav, and there is still no indication of were in the process attachments, avatars, or logos files are to be uploaded. Step 3 Notes:
{quote}
Before the import is started, the JIRA export and optional archives must be uploaded to your Atlassian Cloud instance using WebDAV. For instructions on connecting to your WebDAV directory, [see this documentation | http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Uploading+Data+via+WebDAV]. The import data must be at the root-level of your WebDAV directory and not within a sub-folder.
{quote}
*Also Redirecting to the first document:* [Import and export data | https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/import-and-export-data-744721621.html] with no indication of how or when to do this.
!Screen Shot 2017-02-06 at 4.48.33 PM.png|thumbnail!

Next step Initiates the Restore

Once Restore is successful to upload the Attachments/Avatars/logos  you have to Do the process again but this time upload the zip of the attachments rather than the jira backup,  once complete repeat for each subsequent ZIP file so in total you will need to repeat the full migration process four time to transfer all data once for each:
- jira-backup.zip
- attachments.zip
- avatars.zip
- logos.zip
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud Import Documentation Update required Missing critical info

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64003].
  {panel}

As a team who uses and monitors the Cumulative Flow Diagram (CFD) extensively,

We would like for the CFD report tool to include a toggle that starts the diagram from zero

So that it's easier to analyze the flow when there are many completed items.

*Background*

When there are many issues listed in the bottom most band in the graph, the CFD becomes unreadible as all other bands become very narrow and the vertical movement of the bands may not be very apparent.  Eliminating all issues that move into the bottom most status in the CFD prior to the start of the CFD will effectively reduce the graphed issues and make the graph more useful.

Currently our team is able to get this behavior by using a quickfilter but it is cumbersome as you must adjust the quickfilter whenever the report date range is changed.

This is what the CFD looks like today:
 !cfd_before.png|thumbnail!

This is what it would look like with this feature implemented and enabled:
 !cfd_after.png|thumbnail!  
 
----
*Acceptance Criteria*
 * Include a checkbox in the CFD tool labeled "Exclude already resolved issues"
 ** When the checkbox is checked, limit the issue set being reported with the following additional JQL:
 *** AND ((status != <Right most status that's toggled>) or (status=<Right most status that's toggled> and status changed after <start date of the graph's range>))
 *** e.g. if the final status tracked is "Done" and we start the graph in Jan 1, 2016 the JQL would be: AND ((status = Done and status changed after 01-01-2016) or status != Done)
 ** When the checkbox is not checked, the CFD should behave as it does today
fields.summary: Allow CFD to start from zero with a toggle

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64001].

The JIRA cloud and server rest documentation both state in certain rest resources that they cannot be accessed anonymously. However, when "Anyone" is granted the "Browser User" permission anonymous users can use some rest resources for which the documentation states that they are not permitted access.

The following rest resources have this documentation issue:

1. [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/groupuserpicker-findUsersAndGroups] / [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/groupuserpicker-findUsersAndGroups] 

2. [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/user-findUsersForPicker] / [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/user-findUsersForPicker] 

3. [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/user-findUsers] /  [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/user-findUsers] 

4. [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/user-findUsersWithBrowsePermission] / [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/user-findUsersWithBrowsePermission]

*Official Docker Hub* images for Atlassian Jira, Bitbucket and Confluence are *now available* and is supported in Jira from Jira 8.4 onwards. For Jira Software Docker images, you can find it them: [https://hub.docker.com/r/atlassian/jira-software]

If you’re looking for Kubernetes / OpenShift, please see the related issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-69931
{panel}
*Original request:*

Customers have customizations such as plug-ins and image files, and created few custom workflow integrating with some internal service written in-house, they need to do testing before deploying JIRA prod instance. Therefore, they want to make their installation steps repeatable and testable, using an docker image is a good solution in our case. If they are able to use docker, then they can potentially do a lot of minor version upgrades quickly and more confidently.

For more context, Confluence, and Bitbucket are already available: [https://hub.docker.com/u/atlassian/]

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
If you set the export of jira issues to use pipe delimited and then entered this in the first line
sep=|
then there would be no issue with loading the file in Excel. Because you do not define the separator on export to csv, it does not open in excel correctly. 
This was not an issue with the previous version but in this version, it is comma delimited and named csv... this does not open in most default Excel programs any more.

h3. Suggested Solution
The best solution is to do this:
– set the export to use | (pipe delimited) for a separator
– have the output write the line 'sep=|' on the first line by itself

h3. Why this is important
When you click on it, there is no risk of comma's being an issue and it opens in Excel correctly.

h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
fields.summary: Comma delimited and named csv... these does not open in most default Excel programs any more.

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently you only have the options to use Monday or Sunday as your week start day depending on if ISO8601 standard is being used in look and feel. Some JIRA users will want to set a different day other than Sunday or Monday

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way for users to select their own start day

h3. Why this is important
For unique situations where a company may start their week on a different day of the week.

(i) Many customers are able to change the first day of the week by *changing the system locale*. This might cause issues if they are running on an Oracle database. The problem here is that, Oracle JDBC Driver automatically detects the system locale, and then uses the locale information to set the NLS_SORT parameter when a database session (connection) is made between JIRA and Oracle.

In most cases, Jira detects the database session which is established, as an UNSUPPORTED session collation. This will definitely cause further issues in the future, should they run into any database related problems. Please see [Health Check: The session collation is unsupported by JIRA in Oracle Database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/health-check-the-session-collation-is-unsupported-by-jira-in-oracle-database-828788420.html].
fields.summary: Ability to choose a different day of the week to be the start day

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63965].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA uses XMLRPC to communicate with Confluence in four ways:
 # Retrieve lists of spaces from the instance.
 # Search for content in the instance (globally or by space).
 # Given a {{pageId}}, retrieve page titles and urls for Confluence content.
 # Given a URL, retrieve a {{pageId}} for what is assumed to be Confluence content.

JIRA should use Confluence's REST API to (2). This would resolve a number of issues related to successful searching for content in Confluence – e.g., searching terms that include UTF8 characters (like Japanese, Chinese, etc.).

This is related to JRA-63964, but this issue is concerned with searching for Confluence content, whereas JRA-63964 is concerned with retrieving info for already-linked content.
fields.summary: Use Confluence's REST API to search for page content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63964].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA uses XMLRPC to communicate with Confluence in four ways:
 # Retrieve lists of spaces from the instance.
 # Search for content in the instance (globally or by space).
 # Given a {{pageId}}, retrieve page titles and urls for Confluence content.
 # Given a URL, retrieve a {{pageId}} for what is assumed to be Confluence content.

JIRA should use Confluence's REST API to achieve (3). This would resolve issues with ClassCastExceptions and other remote errors that occur when retrieving Confluence content via XMLRPC.
fields.summary: Use Confluence's REST API to retrieve Confluence page link data

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63957].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The JIRA Admin Helper can help admins diagnose why a user can or cannot perform some actions on a certain issue based on Project Permissions. However, it is not helpful when trying to find out project-based permissions:

# What projects do I have Administer Projects permission on and what grants me that access (e.g. role X/group Z)?
# What projects does user X have Administer Projects permission on and what grants them that access (e.g. role X/group Z)?
# What projects is user X a project lead in so that we can replace them if needed?

You may be able to use:

1)  The following [advanced JQL functions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER072/Advanced+searching+-+functions+reference] which let you search based on roles or permissions, but the output is issue based and not easily represents the projects you have access to. 

{code:borderStyle=solid}project in projectsWhereUserHasPermission("Administer Projects") or project in projectsWhereUserHasRole("Administrators") ORDER BY project{code}

2) The [getPermissions|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/7.2.3/#api/2/-getPermissions] REST call, but you would need to script it out to feed it all projects and clean the data somehow.

3) SQL queries to capture the projects you have admin permissions in.

There is no user-friendly method to get this from JIRA even though this information is critical to manage an enterprise-sized instance.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Expand the scope of the permission helper to be able to get this data, which is essential for general user management.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like the Admin Helper to allow simple permission reporting
Make menus for Issue Types and Projects taller on Modify Configuration Scheme page

Nonce

  {panel}

h3. Definition:

According to [https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-8.0-doc/security-howto.html], only three folders should be writable in JIRA namely, logs, temp and work. However, conf folder is also writable as documented in [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-throws-severe-message-during-startup-due-to-unable-to-create-directory-for-deployment-389781040.html.] 
h3. Suggestion:

Configure tomcat to write to “work/Catalina” instead of “conf/Catalina.
fields.summary: Improve Tomcat Security
Comment links open in new tab option
Only "depends on" linking on CSV import available, "dependency of" required

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63944].
  {panel}

Hi out there,

I use my Agile Scrum Dashboard a lot, but not in a classical way of using sprints, but rather to organize some common stuff in a separate Backlog. This works fine for me.

So since I quite rarely use sprints - allthough I know exactly what it is, it doesn't really fit my requirements - I have to transition quite often Issues to "Start Progress", "Stop Progress" or "Resolve"... This is possible, but only thourgh the "..." Menu -> More Actions, where I can find the transitions....

I would be nice to integrate these transitions steps directly in the popup menu when clicking on "..." Menu button.I can already Edit, Assign, Log Work, Attach Files and more.... But simple transition is some more clicks away....

I know.... I could/or should use sprints, since Backlogs are not really there for transition... But it really depends... At least for me, this would support me in my manner of work.
fields.summary: Faster access to Issue Transition on Agile Backlag

h3. Problem Summary
Editing Project Details as Project Admin will clear the Project Category.

This is because the form data for the following consider empty {{projectCategoryId}} to be null value hence it is updated to "none" for Project Category
{code:borderStyle=dashed}
POST /secure/project/EditProject.jspa?
{code}

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2.x
* User must be Project Admin without JIRA Administrator

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Project Category
# Create a projectA with category
# Assign userA as Project Admin in projectA
# Login as userA and update URL for projectA

h3. Expected Results

Project Category for projectA should remain associated correctly

h3. Actual Results

Project Category is cleared causing missing data

h3.Workaround

None
fields.summary: Project Category is being cleared when Editing Project Details

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63942].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 19 October 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

I'm happy to announce that in [Jira 7.11|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-11-x-release-notes-952600888.html#JiraSoftware7.11.xreleasenotes-projects_columnsMoreinsightsintoyourprojects] we’ve added two columns to the Projects page to help you determine the importance of your projects, so you can decide if they’re worth keeping. Issues and Last issue update will show you the number of issues in a project, and the date of the last update on an issue — just to give you an idea of what’s going on with the projects in your Jira.

!projects_columns2.png|width=100%!

Regards,
 Jakub Kurcek
 Senior Product Manager, Jira Server
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition:

For long established JIRA Servers, over time many projects may no longer be necessary. Knowing when they were created, who owned them, when they were last updated, number of issues, etc. would be a good addition to regular JIRA Server Administration so that unnecessary or old Projects can be pruned on a regular basis.
h3. Suggested Solution:

There should be a tool for native project analysis/archival/mgmt workflow that allows administrators to View _all_ project characteristics, such as: project create date, last updated date, total # of issues, project owners/admins in the Administration are of the product.
h3. Why this is needed:

Reducing the size of a large JIRA Server is good for performance, and makes the server easier to manage.
fields.summary: Project Analysis Tool

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63941].
  {panel}

{panel:title=23rd December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use JIRA and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

We have revisited this issue again recently and will state that there are no plans to currently implement this suggestion. There are already a number of existing add-ons in the [marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/] that handle this use-case, and I recommend utilising them for your instance to add types or attributes the work in Log Work.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.


Regards,
Kerrod Williams
Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

///

For each task we need a little IMPLEMENTATION, ANALAYSIS, PROJECT MANAGMENT, TESTING, DOCUMENTATION...I wouldn't like to split one task into several tasks just to know how much time was spent on different types of work.

It would be great if user could specify what type of work was he doing in Log Work.
fields.summary: Add type of work in Log work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Workflow in issue won't load when selecting the View workflow option directly from the View Issue screen

h3. Environment
* Tempo add-ons installed
* Expired Tempo license

h3. Steps to replicate
# Install a Tempo Add-on and allow the license to expire without disabling the add-on manually
# Go to any existing issues
# Click on *View Workflow*

h3. Expectation
The project's workflow is displayed

h3. Actual Result
Spinning wheels loading endlessly

We can see this error in the browser's javascript console:{noformat}Uncaught TypeError: this.html.droppable is not a function(…)init {noformat}

h3. Cause
Similar to The Cloud BUG {{https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-63377}} where Recent changes in JIRA are causing the Tempo Core add-on (bundled in JIRA Cloud system add-ons) to manifest this error when Tempo Timesheets is disabled.

*BUT* In contrast to the Cloud Behavior, This is caused by manually installing a tempo plugin For the Server installations and the Tempo Add-on being installed and enabled while having an expired license.

h3. Workaround
Renew the license for the Tempo Add-on OR Disable / Uninstall the tempo Add-on, and the system plug-in dependencies

Exe: Testing With Tempo Planner the add installs all the following add-ons that must all be manually disabled:
{code}
Tempo Planner
System Plugin: Tempo Teams
System Plugin: Tempo Planning API
System Plugin: Tempo Core
System Plugin: Tempo Accounts
{code}

Testing with Tempo Timesheets the following add-ons that must all be manually disabled:
{code}
Tempo Timesheets
System Plugin: Tempo Teams
System Plugin: Tempo Planning API
System Plugin: Tempo Core
System Plugin: Tempo Accounts
{code}
fields.summary: Workflow view within issue does not load in JIRA Server with expired Tempo license

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63939].
  {panel}

Our JIRA Database administrator has notified us of the following issues on our LJIRA01 DB. Can you please help with the action item.
Findings and Recommendations
---------------------------------------------------
Finding 1: Commits and Rollbacks
Impact is 10.53 active sessions, 78.61% of total activity.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Waits on event "log file sync" while performing COMMIT and ROLLBACK operations
were consuming significant database time.
Recommendation 1: Application Analysis
Estimated benefit is 10.53 active sessions, 78.61% of total activity.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Action:Investigate application logic for possible reduction in the number of COMMIT operations by increasing the size of transactions.
Rationale:The application was performing 58855 transactions per minute with an average redo size of 645 bytes per transaction
fields.summary: Optimize Database COMMIT operations

h2. Problem Definition

When the Contact Site Administrators form is enabled, users could create SPAM or abuse the system as there is no CAPTCHA for that form.
h2. Suggested Solution

Add a CAPTCHA to the Contact Site Adminsitrator form to avoid SPAM
  
h2. Workaround

There is no workaround apart from not having the form enabled.
fields.summary: Add a CATPCHA or a method to stop spam to the "Contact Site Administrator Form"

fields.summary: Accessing project settings for mutiple projects simultaneously leads to high CPU usage

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63935].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

There is a limit on the number of character in Comment, Description, etc. Sometime, users would add a huge text as a comment/description and it would be great if JIRA could automatically convert it into a file and attach it as an issue attachment.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to automatically convert huge text into a file and attach is as an issue attachment.
fields.summary: Provide a feature to automatically convert huge text into a file
Update REST API issue properties documentation
API Documentation for Cookie Based authentication needs update

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Subtasks no longer inherit fixversion from parent task upon creation. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue like a Story. 
# Set a fix version for it
# Create a subtask under it

h3. Expected Results
# Subtask created will inherit parents fix version. 

h3. Actual Results
Subtask doesn't inherit parents fix version. 

h3. Notes
This works fine in JIRA 7.0.5
fields.summary: Subtasks do not inherit fixversion when created from parent task.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63929].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
It is possible that an installed plugin is enabled on some of the nodes while disabled on the other nodes on the same JIRA Data Center installation.

h3. Suggested Solution
Health Check for JIRA DC should check the status of these installed plugin for each node so the administrator will be informed and enable them manually.

h3. Why this is important
Inconsistency in reviewing data or functionality for users on different nodes.
 
h3. Workaround 
Run {{http://<nodeURL>/rest/plugins/1.0/enablement-state}} on each nodes to check the add-ons enable status.
fields.summary: Health Check to check add-on status on JIRA Data Center
Document the /status URL for JIRA
Allow users to categorize or label filters so that Manage Filters isn't some massive, undifferentiated list

fields.description:
When a project administrator (not JIRA administrator) changes a project avatar it resets the project category. The project category field is read-only, so there is no workaround by f.e. setting the project category manually.

 

Steps to reproduce:
 * Login as a project administrator (role administrator for a project)
 * Go to project
 * Click project settings
 * Click details
 * Select different avatar
 * Save

 

Expected result:
 * Project category is still the same
 !new_image_category_correct.JPG|thumbnail! 
 

Actual result:
 * Project category is "none"
 !new_image_saved_category_reset.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Project category is reset when project admin changes project avatar

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If lots of Gadget is placed in a dashboard and the last gadget does not display a long result or does have any issues in the specified filter. That particular gadget cannot be edited.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* JIRA 7.1.9
* JIRA 7.3.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add few gadgets in dashboard in vertical position
# Make sure the last added gadget have no result of the filter
# Try to click Top menu in the gadget to edit it

h3. Expected Results
The edit button appears and we can edit the gadget.

h3. Actual Results
The Edit button is hidden behind the main layout of dashboard as shown in below image:
!error.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Reposition the gadget to edit it.
fields.summary: Cannot Edit Gadget in Dashboard for The last Placed Gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63924].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
[Unattended installation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/unattended-installation-855475683.html] of JIRA starts JIRA automatically after installation. As of JIRA 7.3, using the installer will give you the option to startup JIRA or not after the installation. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a parameter to specify the instance not to startup after the upgrade/installation.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I would like Unattended installation of JIRA to have the option to not start automatically
